body_html:
There is a dependency chain between //tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_lite and @gif_archive//:gif:

$ bazel query "somepath(tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_lite, @gif_archive//:gif)"
//tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_lite
//tensorflow/core:android_srcs
//tensorflow/core:proto_text_srcs_all
//tensorflow/tools/proto_text:gen_proto_text_functions
//tensorflow/core:lib
//tensorflow/core:lib_internal
//tensorflow/core/platform/default/build_config:platformlib
@gif_archive//:gif

@martinwicke @raingo I think this may be from #3264

As gif support is unnecessary for the Android build, is there any easy way we can make the build proceed despite gif_archive not having been configured?
body:
There is a dependency chain between //tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_lite and @gif_archive//:gif:

> $ bazel query "somepath(tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_lite, @gif_archive//:gif)"
> //tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib_lite
> //tensorflow/core:android_srcs
> //tensorflow/core:proto_text_srcs_all
> //tensorflow/tools/proto_text:gen_proto_text_functions
> //tensorflow/core:lib
> //tensorflow/core:lib_internal
> //tensorflow/core/platform/default/build_config:platformlib
> @gif_archive//:gif

@martinwicke @raingo I think this may be from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/3264

As gif support is unnecessary for the Android build, is there any easy way we can make the build proceed despite gif_archive not having been configured?
